comment: db meter for tv signal

title: Great for pointing the antenna
comment: Superb app for showing all the facets of digital TV reception - signal strength, signal to noise, and most importantly, symbol quality. Some channels with great strength and SN ratio have intermittent symbol dropouts that otherwise wouldn't be noticeable until viewing. This app shows it all. If you've got an HDHomeRun, you really should get this too.

title: Dream come true
comment: I was the guy with the laptop... So practical, silicondust should pay you and advertise the app on their site.  I get all the info I need to aim the antenna without climbing ladders so often or lugging laptops to the roof in the middle of winter.

title: Very useful!
comment: Just what I needed. And thank you for making it free!
Isn't support for mobile

title: Does what it claims; and that's the best that can be said.
comment: I don't have the time it would take to describe all the ways this app is disappointing.  In order to adjust an antennae using this app you would have to have a pencil and paper to write down all of the station number translations during the 15+ minutes it takes to manually "scan" each individual station.  Then manually type in the stations you want to tune/adjust in a tedious process of turn, type, wait, repeat.  The alternative is to "scan" them several times to make sure getting one station clear doesn't undo the tuning of another. This, of course, would take several hours if you live anywhere near a metropolitan area.  There are 2 or 3 extremely simple UI enhancements that could make this "simple" app actually usable. Since this hasn't happened in the last year, I don't expect it anytime soon. For the love of all that's usable, couldn't you at least retain the list of tuned stations to scroll through?!  From my experience with app development, I can only imagine that the original app was written in less than an hour and the only development time devoted to it since has been debugging.

title: Great app to adjust the antenna!
comment: This app is very helpful in adjusting the antenna remotely.  The only thing I could possibly find missing is the frequencies being tuned to.  The app on the computer does show that when it scans though.  Sometimes when the signal is less than 100% but still green the whole bat goes green.
Its not clear on how to use, not functioning as well.

title: Amazing tool
comment: I loved being able to check the signal while up in the attic. While it took me a minute to figure out, changing the channel was extremely useful when trying to balance between two stations in different directions.

title: A little buggy but worth its weight in gold
comment: I just installed an antenna in the attic, in August, in Houston. Needless to say I didn't want to stay up there long. This app let me measure signal strength from my phone while in the attic adjusting the antenna. I couldn't be more grateful.

title: Very helpful
comment: Super easy to use, so helpful for checking signal strength.
Latest version works great with TC. Thanks!

title: Works Great!
comment: Much nicer than yelling at the wife to get the signal strength as I move the antenna around in our attic.

comment: Can't manually enter US ATSC channels like 2.1

title: Works great
comment: You can use this to select a channel then watch it for free with XBMC on android.  Pretty useful for checking signal as well.  Great job.

comment: Works as described. Ability to reboot device, without unplugging, makes it 5 stars.

comment: If there was a way to save a set of channels that would complete this project.  Great work.

comment: Great to use for aiming  antennas.

title: Wow
comment: Very useful !

title: Great app

title: Perfect tool for attic antenna alignments!
comment: Would have been much more of a hassle to tune my antenna as I I've had to try a couple along with an amplifier, being 46 miles from the local TV stations and behind a couple small mountains.  Keep up the great work on this John!

title: Better but still needs work
comment: I like this app but it still has some annoying problems on my GS3.  Bars don't change length with changing values and the tuned channel will sometimes change when the screen is rotated.

comment: Broke like a joke. Won't tune channels.

title: Awesome!
comment: Boy does this help with attic aerials! Thank you!

title: Great app
comment: Great app, I use it often. Thank you for fixing the channel erasing issue.
Crash on startup

title: 1.2.1 still broken
comment: Since the 1.2.1 running now works. However you can't change the channel. As soon as you type another one it erases itself and automatically puts back the channel that was there. You also can't stop it from tuning, previously the refresh Button stopped it, now all it dies is switch you to another tuner. So now once u check 4 channels if I want to check another I must reboot the hdhrs.

title: can't easily change frequency
comment: signal strength and other stats gave this two stars, but I cannot change the channel easily. one of every ten tries will the app actually go to another channel. app is that useful. it's easier to just see how the TV reception changes.

title: Cannot type channel.
comment: After update in march 10. Can no longer type channel in box.  Everytime I try to type it just writes current channel.  Used to be great now less then helpful.

title: Handy app!
comment: Love this app for adjusting my antenna rotator for best signal strength from my armchair.  No need to drill down into my HTPC's "Hdhomerun Setup" program or worse, my TV's well-hidden signal strength menu.  I an adjust my antenna for max sig. strength right from my armchair.  Ver. 1.2 was broken, but I emailed the developer here, and he fixed it right away.  Works good again.  Thank goodness I was able to edit my review.  Lesson learned.  Next time I will email FIRST, before leaving any kind of less-than-stellar review.
Barely works

title: Awesome!
comment: Thank you so much for this App...I was able to align my antenna on my roof while watching the signal strength in this app.  Sooo much easier than getting a second person via radio to relay the info.   Only thing better would be to be able to view the channel on screen.

comment: App works, and layout similar to what you see setting up tuner on PC.

title: Great Utility
comment: This app woks very well.

title: Bravo

title: Doesn't find my HDHR3
comment: Doesn't auto-find my hdhr3 from wifi, can't set device ip statically.  Useless app

title: A MUST HAVE App for ALL HDHomeRun owners!
comment: Now this is a real time saving App when your setting up your HDHomeRun!! This App is a must when determining the best place to position your Dual's HD antenna, and/or even when validating the quality of your in wall coax runs, splitters, loss and checking for end point SNR with either the Dual or Prime with CC!!  The only way to make this any better would be to have an automated select channel 'sweep' loop that you could setup to identify 2 or 3 channels to cycle between when you posistion the Antenna in order to determine a best physical averaging position for placement considering your favorite channels. This would help those of us trying to locate that perfect sweet spot with HD stations located in all directions (city) vs mainly located in one direction (suburbs and outskirts) when tuning for  signal averaging vs peaking.

title: Excellent, works perfectly!
comment: Got this downloaded just as I was hooking up my new HD antenna to my newly purchased HDHomerun, and this was perfect for making sure I had everything pointed correctly along with checking my Coax connections.  Awesome app!

title: Great tool!
comment: Now to watch HD-Homerun TV on my Android devices too...

title: Just what I was looking for
comment: Needed a way to check my antenna aim from the roof.This is it.

title: Great app!
comment: This is a big help when I'm adjusting antennae in my attic!

title: Ok app
comment: It kept losing the tuner when the phone flipped to landscape.

title: Wonderful....streaming pretty please
comment: Great app! I read in the silicon dust forum that you have a version of this app that streams video. Please please please release it even if it is a little buggy. The community has waited years for this ability.

comment: Thank you! VNC or hauling my netbook outside was getting silly. Update: Still awesome. Practically a must.
If you are installing an HDHomerun then you probably need thus app! Works great with my Prime

title: great tool for tuning antenna

title: No more laptop in the attic!
comment: Fantastic! This is a huge help when I'm up in the attic trying to adjust my antennas. It works flawlessly. One suggestion, it would be nice to have two buttons to quickly scroll through frequencies (instead of auto-scanning) so that I don't have to type in a specific number.

title: Very usefull
comment: Had been using the windows version of hdhomerun config on my pc and using remote desktop 2x client on my phone which worked ok.  This app is much easier.  It would be nice to see multiple tuners at once for finding the sweet spot between channels.

title: Long awaited!
comment: Glad someone made an HDHR app.. now I don't need to bring the laptop on the roof for tweaks.  Haven't run into any issues yet, overall very nice app.

title: Great!
comment: A lot better than hauling the laptop up on the roof! Just perfect!
